definition: to take leave
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in

sentences.english: They left the school in a hurry, without saying goodbye to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 他們沒有同任何人辭別，就匆匆離開了學校。

sentences.english: He bade his wife farewell and set out on his journey.
sentences.chinese: 他辭別了妻子便啓程了。

sentences.english: Yamaguchi died Monday at the age of 93.
sentences.chinese: 本週一山口疆辭別了人世，享年93歲。

sentences.english: The Emperor consented to send Zhaojun. While bidding farewell. the Emperor saw Zhaojun for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 在臨行辭別的時候，元帝才首次見到昭君的美貌。

sentences.english: And when we had bid one another farewell , we took ship; and they returned home.
sentences.chinese: 彼此辭別後，我們上了船，他們就回家去了。

sentences.english: But bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, if God will.
sentences.chinese: 就辭別他們說，神若許我，我還要回到你們這裏。

sentences.english: Gann was careful to write 3 a. m. on the farewell note.
sentences.chinese: 江恩非常仔細的在辭別信上寫上了凌晨3點鐘。

sentences.english: Some people prefer to see the old year out at a church service.
sentences.chinese: 有些人更喜歡在教堂裏辭別舊的一年。

sentences.english: The song is a dying protagonist's farewell to relatives and friends.
sentences.chinese: 這首歌唱出了主人公臨終前對親朋好友的辭別之情。

sentences.english: And when he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.
sentences.chinese: 他既辭別了他們，就往山上去禱告。

sentences.english: We paused for a moment, and then the women said goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 我們停留了一會兒，然後她們就辭別離去了。

sentences.english: YangGuang to yangzhou fief, farewell queen mother queen dugu.
sentences.chinese: 楊廣前往揚州封地，辭別母后獨孤皇后。

definition: on leaving/on the point of departure
to resign a government post
Guoxing or Kuohsing township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
to notify/to inform
to die in battle (idiom)
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
feast/celebration
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to give a farewell dinner
to say goodbye/leave-taking/farewells
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to leave office
to drown one's sorrows (in alcohol)
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
